content:
Chaos Space Marine Sorcerers are some of the most depraved
and demented individuals encountered by the forces of the
Imperium. During the events of the Horus Heresy, many of
them came from the ranks of the Thousand Sons Legion,
which had a greater proportion of Astartes with the psyker
mutation.
extraSubCategories:
Awareness (Per), Climb (S), Command (Fel) +10,
Dodge (Ag) +10, Intimidate (S) +20, Literacy (Int),
Lore: Forbidden (Daemonology, Psykers, The Warp) (Int),
Lore: Scholastic (Legend, Numerology, Occult) (Int) +10,
Psyniscience (Int) +20, Scrutiny (Per), Speak Language (Low
Gothic) (Int), Survival (Int), Swim (S).

Astartes Weapon Training, Bolter Drill, Die Hard,
Fearless, Hatred (Loyalist Space Marines), Heightened Senses
(Sight, Sound, Smell), Jaded, Killing Strike, Quick Draw,
Rapid Reload, Size (Hulking), Swift Attack, True Grit.

Dark Sight, †Mark of Chaos, Unnatural Strength (x2),
Unnatural Toughness (x2).

Astartes Power Armour (Head 8, Arms 8, Body 10,
Legs 8).

Force Sword (1d10+19 R; Pen 7; Balanced,
Special), Astartes Bolt Pistol (30m; S/3/-; 2d10+5 X;
Pen 5; Clip 12; Rld Full; Tearing), Astartes Combat Blade
(1d10+14 R; Pen 2).

4 bolt pistol magazines, Sorcerer Robes, Pendant or
Emblem with mark of sworn Chaos God.

Psy Rating: 5

Psychic Powers: Choose two of the Chaos Psychic Powers found on page 127.

†Mark of Chaos: The Sorcerer possesses one of the following Marks of Chaos. This Mark appears somewhere on his body and is also emblazoned upon his armour—Nurgle, Slaanesh, or Tzeentch. See page 363 of the Deathwatch Rulebook for information on how these Marks work. The Sorcerer may only ever possess a single Mark and may not change that Mark.
